title: Kate Garraway is on the receiving end of an x-rated dance
text:
Kate Garraway found herself out of her comfort zone on Thursday evening while attending a no-holds barred Magic Mike Live show at the London Palladium.

Better used to playful banter with Ben Shepherd, the Good Morning Britain co-host was completely speechless during a raunchy striptease from a male dancer.

After being invited onstage, the overwhelmed presenter, 52, took her place on a metal chair as the baying crowd urged the dance troupe to perform.

Racy: Kate Garraway found herself out of her comfort zone on Thursday evening while attending a no-holds barred Magic Mike Live show at the London Palladium

Happy to oblige, Kate could only look on helplessly as the shirtless dancer ground his hips on her lap and ran his hands through her hair.

Pulling away, he performed a perfunctory dance before returning to carry out an impressive handstand by placing his hands on either side of Kate's chair and lifting himself into an upright position.

But while the performance looked completely unplanned, it was all part of Kate's goal to make guest appearances in five separate west end musicals on the same night for Global Radio's Make Some Noise national charity.

Here we go: Better used to playful banter with Ben Shepherd, the Good Morning Britain co-host was completely speechless while on the receiving end of a raunchy striptease from a male dancer

He's off: Pulling away from the presenter, he performed a short dance with second shirtless hunk as a bewildered Kate looked on

On a busy evening the presenter also made guest appearances in Big! The Musical, School of Rock, Waitress and Mama Mia.

Taking to Instagram, Kate admitted she almost missed her slot in Waitress at the Adelphi Theatre after being delayed by her protracted appearance at Magic Mike Live.

'We’ve had a bit of a disaster,' she explained. 'I took so long at Magic Mike, not entirely my fault, but I’ve missed my slot on Waitress.

'I’ve missed my scene completely, so I don’t know what I’m gonna do because I don't want to lose my next slot on Mama Mia.'

Fortunately producers were able to squeeze Kate in before she sped across the West End with a motorcycle courier for her appearance in Mama Mia at the Novello Theatre.

Look who's back: He soon returned, placed his hands on either side of Kate's chair and performing a handstand

Pre-planned: While the performance looked completely unplanned, it was all part of Kate's plan to make guest appearances in five separate west end musicals on the same night

Well done Kate: The presenter appeared in five musicals in just one day for Global Radio's Make Some Noise Day charity event, among them ABBA-inspired singalong Mama Mia!

The Magic Mike performance followed an equally raunchy routine carried out with former Saturdays star Frankie Bridge, another celebrity guests to attend the West End show.

Married Frankie, 30, was selected to join a shirtless hunk on stage as he swept her up in the air before she wrapped her legs around his waist.

Other stars to have received provocative dances at Magic Mike Live over the summer include All Saints' Natalie Appleton and Shaznay Lewis, as well as TOWIE's Shelby Tribble.

Magic Mike Live is a spin-off show to the hit 2012 Channing Tatum film also starring Joe Manganiello and Matthew McConaughey.

Previously: The presenter shared a shot of her rehearsals for the show earlier that day

The real thing: Kate later admitted the whole experience had been a 'bit of a blur'
description: Better used to a gentle ribbing from Ben Shepherd, the Good Morning Britain co-host was given a raunchy striptease from a male dancer after being invited onstage.
